channel.title: Need help bringing server online
channel.description:
my run server has the enabled message.my router has a different layout from the instructions in the ultimate server guide but i've enetered in the information as best as i can my port range is 43594 and ends at 43594 ive set the protocol to tcp tried it still didnt work, tried udp didnt work, and i tried both still didnt work ive enabled the port ive got my gateway ip set and named the application. When i start to register my server it says my server is offline.
[br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2007, 05:00:44 PM[/size][hr]does anyone know what to do next, i still havent figured it out

item.title: Need help bringing server online
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

Yes, you need to make your port available in the “Exceptions” tab in your firewall. Then, you need to create and host a no-ip at www.no-ip.com . You need to port forward and update your No-ip on DUC to read your DNS server. With all that completed, it should be online.

I would post pics, but I’m very lazy atm and have been all day.

~Play N Skillz

Read full topic
